website_summaries.verdict: Adds fun new gameplay components to the classic Clue structure, which Potter fans from pre-teens to adults will enjoy.
pros: Complex strategy and rules that build the Hogwarts realm into the Clue universe
New components like House Points, Dark Mark cards, and new secret passageways
cons: Game takes a bit longer to play due to its complexity
Gameboard text is tiny and hard to read

customer_reviews.title: Way better than regular Clue
customer_reviews.text: Our family absolutely LOVES this game. I grew up playing Clue, and it was one of my favorite games. However, I like this version even more. They have added some complexity to the game that makes it more challenging and, in my opinion, a lot more fun. It takes a little longer to play this version because of the added complexity (don't worry, it isn't too complex), but it is so much fun! I highly recommend this to any Clue or Harry Potter fan. Even if you don't think you like the game Clue, you might like this because of the changes to the game.
customer_reviews.author: Domesticated

customer_reviews.title: Harry Potter Clue Game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game for my 10 yr. old granddaughter. We gave this to her a few days ago. She is a big Harry Potter fan. For 3 to 5 players. She loved the game. We all enjoyed it. Has extra moves to make which makes it more interesting. If she is happy, Grandma is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Proud Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to a Potter Fan. So much fun and adds an additional twist to the original clue gameplay. If you can't find the labels for the dice, flip through the notes book, ours were hidden in there.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: More difficult then I remembered (ages 9+) LOL
customer_reviews.text: My friend & I were talking about how much we loved the game Clue when we were kids (in the 70s) -- I ordered this one (which adds a bit more to the original game) & we broke it out over a bottle (or two) of wine. It was fun, but we did have to re-read the directions more than once or twice (wine??) It was a nice afternoon & let us reminisce. Would recommend that an adult need to assist the younger kids on directions.
customer_reviews.author: Dacosta

customer_reviews.title: Better than regular Clue
customer_reviews.text: Super fun! It has more components to it than regular Clue, so it gives more twists to the game. My husband and I made it easily work as only a 2 player game and it was a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Crawford

customer_reviews.title: ... is cute and the kids that got it are happy with it and like it
customer_reviews.text: This clue game is cute and the kids that got it are happy with it and like it. My complaint is the colors are drab and it is hard to tell where you are going and which room is which because of the lack of color. Also the print in the game is very small it is hard to read and that along with the lack of color I found annoying. The changing rooms was fun and that is a plus, but I would pick a different clue game to play over this version.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Not as much fun as the original clue
customer_reviews.text: Hard to understand. Not as much fun as the original clue. Moral is Everything Harry Potter isn't good.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Dotson

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the family who loves Harry Potter
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a family Christmas present with 7 and 9 year old kids who love Harry Potter. They also really love board games. It was a little complicated at 1st, but once we got the hang of it, it was a lot of fun! My 7 year old still maybe doesn't quite get the concept of clue and when to mark people off of his sheet, but he still has fun playing. My 9 year old seemed to pick it up very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Audreysmama226

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy and Brings a Nice Twist!
customer_reviews.text: The game was easy and everyone enjoyed it. We saw it in the store but did not like the price. So we checked Amazon and it was definitely cheaper. The game is easy to pickup especially if you played the original Clue. The added components of the game made this that much more enjoyable. My only complaint might be that the board inserts for the spin wheels might wear out over time and you definitely cannot remove them once installed so the box becomes tight after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Even better than original Clue!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely an improvement over "regular" Clue. We love Harry Potter, so Clue Harry Potter sounded fun, but it has additional features that actually make the game better without over-complicating it. There are House Points, Help Cards & Dark Mark cards, and the game design is awesome with secret passageways that are always changing (instead of the static corner-to-corner secret passageways in original Clue). So happy this finally came down to a reasonable price! We love it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Understand Rules
customer_reviews.text: If you think this will be similar to the regular Clue game, think again. It is much more difficult. We tried to play but it was so frustrating with additional rules and cards, we quit. I thought it would be just like Clue with different rooms, characters and weapons to match HP characters. I would not have bought this if I had known.
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Price

customer_reviews.title: Fun game, but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Harry Potter clue is definitely a fun variation of the original game. My main issue though is that everything in the game is made out of cheap cardboard.... At the very least I feel like the character pieces and money should be made out of plastic. You even have to put stickers on the die ....even that doesn't come in one plastic piece. For the money, the game should be made a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Love clue / love Harry Potter!
customer_reviews.text: I really love the Clue game part & the moving secret passages. The HP aspects are not well explained in the instructions but thanks to the internet I figured it out. There are some new HP aspects that are kind of dumb (house points - only loose, cant earn, student lost in the building) but like I said the moving passages are cool. I do think it was overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. L.

customer_reviews.title: Games for Adult Children
customer_reviews.text: My adult daughter who has been a fan since the first book was published, was so thrilled to get this for an early Easter present. She can't wait to play it with her adult friends for a night of fun. Clue is a fun sort of group-relaxing game and making it for the Harry Potter characters was a stroke of genesis since they all would fit in well as either victim or perpetrator. Hope she invites me to play sometime too. Great idea for a game for any age.
customer_reviews.author: Jane T

customer_reviews.title: Best version of Clue
customer_reviews.text: I do not like Clue. I really do not like it at all. I am an elitist board game snob. I am not even a Harry Potter fan, Fantastic Beasts yes, Harry Potter, not at all. I still gave this four stars. It still has many of the down sides of traditional Clue. We have all seen "new Clue" games, that are not new. This feels new. The way you move around the board adds so very much to the game. If you like Clue and or Harry Potter, just buy this. To you it will be a five star purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than regular Clue even for non-Harry Potter fans
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after our 6 year old Harry Potter fan outgrew Clue Jr. I’m not a Harry Potter fan, but I also like this game. Other reviews describe the twists, and I think they make this game more fun and interesting than regular Clue. We modified the rules so that a loss of House Points means you show a card. Game play with three people takes about 15-20 minutes. More players adds time of course. Fun game.
customer_reviews.author: Mh

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun version!
customer_reviews.text: This version of CLUE is so much fun!! I didn't realize when I bought it that it had so many different rules (in a good way). The secret passageways change based on what you get when you roll the dice, you can lose house points (which can knock you out of the game early), and the cards add more unpredictability to the game. It is also surprisingly sturdy. Super fun for a Harry Potter and CLUE lover!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Cute but defective game pieces. Need help.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift. The set up of the game took a little time. We had some questions with some black cards that were either blank or had numbers on them. There wasn’t any explanation on how to use these. Also the black die that was supposed to have a star or dark mark or house symbols on it was blank also- so it proved useless to the game. The game was cute in design but the set up was defective due to missing pieces. We had to leave out some rules in order to play. Can I get an explanation or the correct pieces?
customer_reviews.author: Jennise Knight

customer_reviews.title: Twists and Ever Changing Fun in Hogwarts Castle!
customer_reviews.text: Harry Potter Clue is fabulous! Each game is a new adventure, saving a different student, using ever changing secret passageways, confronting a surprise closed fire, using spells, and more. A fun twist with the use of house points too. Don’t hesitate... I have played Clue for almost 40 years, and was worried about a themed version. I won’t play anything but Harry Potter now!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy B

customer_reviews.title: Cool Game!
customer_reviews.text: the creators of this game should get A++ on creativity and authenticity! So many cool updates to it really makes it feel like Harry Potter! Love their attention to detail. The rules are more complicated than regular clue and you have to really pay attention bc parts of the board get moved with each roll of the die but it is perfect for my preteen Harry Potter fans!!!
customer_reviews.author: S.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for H.Potter fans - price a little high
customer_reviews.text: This version of Clue is great. I got it as a gift for my 9 & 11 year old nieces who are avid Harry Potter fans. My only complaint was the $39 price tag for little in detailed pieces. The game board is beautiful & good quality but the game pieces were cardboard cut-outs & the meeples representing their characters were cheap plastic pawn pieces. Fun game however, just recommend you find it cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: D. from FL

customer_reviews.title: What a fun adaptation!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously my family loves the world of Harry Potter, and this is no exception to that love. There is a fun twist with this one where doors and secret paths open and close randomly with dice rolls (make sure you place the disks on the correct houses! we didn't read the wheels the first time we assembled it!). We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Salter

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy!
customer_reviews.text: The game does not look anything like the picture. Why? Instead of Harry Potter on the front of the game (as shown on the picture) it’s a lesser known character. Ugh! Amazon quotes the game as $28 and I paid $41 when all was said and done! I’m not happy. This game is supposed to be a gift to someone who likes Harry Potter - not the person who is actually in the front of the game. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: jmm

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the original
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the original. This version is not too complicated like some say, it just adds more strategy because the game adds a multitude of variables. So not only do you need to find out who done it, but strategizing to protect yourself from being eliminated from the game before you even get to guess! Doors open and lock, secret passages are always changing and you have to protect yourself from the dark mark cards. If you love HP and clue, you'll not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: A fun twist on a classic game- even if you aren't a big Harry Potter fan
customer_reviews.text: The HP geeks in my family (which is everyone but me) really love this game. I'm not a big fan of HP, but the game is a fun twist on the normal Clue since the doorways and secret passages change with every turn, and events happen in the hallway that make travelling between rooms (usually the most boring aspect) much more interesting than the standard version. It's not too easy, not too hard, and there are enough variables to make this really fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey's Mama

customer_reviews.title: If you like CLUE, yes. If you just like Harry Potter, maybe not.
customer_reviews.text: If you're a fan of the game CLUE and like Harry Potter, this is a great game. It adds a coat of fresh paint to the game in the form of new characters, locations, items, etc. But, if you're a Harry Potter fan then this might not be the game for you because CLUE is a pretty slow game, even by boardgame standards. We got it and my wife loves HP, but the game of CLUE almost put her to sleep so it wasn't for her.
customer_reviews.author: Y3ahHim

customer_reviews.title: she enjoys the original game of Clue and she LOVES Harry Potter so it was a good match. This game is pretty fun-a bit longer ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this game for my daughter for Christmas, she enjoys the original game of Clue and she LOVES Harry Potter so it was a good match. This game is pretty fun-a bit longer to play than the original, there are a few more steps and an additional die and moving secret passageways on the game board, these make it more magical. It is a bit more complicated to start but we caught on quickly and-you can play it just like original Clue if you choose. Lots of fun for my 13 year old who is a very picky game player.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: not easy to read board
customer_reviews.text: The game board rooms all looked the same and the text was hard to read. There was no obvious difference in appearance so you have to really look close and read the text to figure out where you were. The board is very monochromatic.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Di

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts - Amazon Resolved Quickly
customer_reviews.text: This game is super fun. It keeps the game of Clue interesting with moving doors and Help cards. My family likes Harry Potter and we enjoy playing this game. I received this game missing parts. There is a moving game board with four house wheels, but I only received two of the wheels. I have been so excited for this game, so I'm disappointed that we can't play it. I wish the missing parts could just be shipped to me. Bummer. (Resolved quickly!)
customer_reviews.author: Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment for the price
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment for the price. For over $40 for a board game you'd at least expect more than cardboard cutouts for the suspects and instruments. The game has embellishments on the original clue that drag it out, but don't make it more fun. I think the original game was much better.
customer_reviews.author: Nana V

customer_reviews.title: Harry Potter + Clue = A Family Game Night
customer_reviews.text: Played it once. Overall it was good. Wife and daughter love the Harry Potter theme. The board’s text and dice are a bit hard to read. Also, we didn’t enjoy the HP/point/token aspect of it because it seemed aggressive without wasting time/rolls to receive useless “help” cards. We may use them but start out with twice as many next time we play until we feel it out more.
customer_reviews.author: Bossy 70

customer_reviews.title: Best Board Game Ever
customer_reviews.text: As both a Clue and Harry Potter lover, it was clear I was going to like this game before I even played it the first time. However, I can say with certainty I LOVE THIS GAME. I played it once years ago at a friends house and was addicted, and searched the internet religiously to find it to buy for myself. This version of Clue has all the elements of the traditional game, with all the fun and zany twists of the Harry Potter world. The rules are a little confusing and can be hard to understand, but I still give it 5 stars because it is so much fun it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Played this last night, and I adore the play mechanisms on this game. I had bought this almost exclusively because the gameboard had moving components, and I was not at all disappointed. Recommend. My only wish was for more characters from different houses to play - I had no Hufflepuffs I could play as!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun Update to the classic game
customer_reviews.text: Game play in the Harry Potter Clue is different from the classic. This isn't just a themed game, it's a whole new way to play. Set up takes a little longer, and you will definitely need the rule sheet handy the first time you play. Great fun if you play with someone who is not HP obsessed. Listening to your mom butcher magical names will be your new favorite past time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect family game
customer_reviews.text: This immediately became our family's favorite game. Same premise as original clue but with awesome Harry Potty twists. Easy to assemble and play.
customer_reviews.author: Ali J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Missing very important pieces to play the game! NONE of the cards were in the box! HUGE  disappointment when we opened the game!
customer_reviews.text: We open the game, from a sealed box, and none of the important playing cards were in there! And of course we can't even play the game we bought. I would give zero stars but I didn't have that option
customer_reviews.author: Tara S

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and confusing
customer_reviews.text: Not worth extra money for the theme Harry potter..game was confusing to tween who I thought would love it as she is advote reader, loves Harry potter and plays regular Clue..
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Open up ASAP
customer_reviews.text: We did not open box to play till everyone was available. First, missing stickers off of black die and too late for me to report to seller. Second, so many rules we all got bored with the game. You need a person who knows all the rules to help others to play. I doubt we will ever play this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mary J. Sallas

customer_reviews.title: Fun new twist!
customer_reviews.text: Fun twist on the classic clue game. There are dials that are attached to the board for each house, it was a little confusing at first (read the directions) but once we got going it was really neat. Basically instead of always going to the same place for secret passeges, they change locations! Neat twist that makes the game more interesting.
customer_reviews.author: JaymeB

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: We had a blast playing this game! We're big Harry Potter fans and my family just loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah and Jeff J.

customer_reviews.title: Family Game Night!
customer_reviews.text: We play this regularly. My daughters are huge fans of the Harry Potter series. The game has some added components that do not exist in the original Clue Game that make the game more challenging. My family is torn about whether these extras enhance the game in a meaningful or arbitrary way. However, we all have fun playing this together as a family, the graphics on the board and cards are outstanding, and it is the perfect gift for a fan who also loves board games.
customer_reviews.author: NJMom

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for my daughter and it was a hit. We have played it several times and it is pretty much like the regular Clue with a few extra things going on during the game. The quality is decent. It takes a little time to put the game together for the first time. It is what is described in the product description & images. Overall a good gift for an HP fan. If you like Clue and Harry Potter it is a no brainer!
customer_reviews.author: SunnyZ

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game. It's different from the main CLUE in a variety of ways, and very layered in the strategies and play. My 9 year old loves it, but I think it would be too hard for anyone younger. Our group of young adult friends enjoyed this immensely.
customer_reviews.author: RIstowfam

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: We love the game! It's got concepts like the original Clue, bit new twists that really make it Harry Potter-esk. The secret passage ways change and lead to different rooms which is fun. You also have house points and have to pay occasionally if you don't have the people or spells needed to cast it off.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Our grandchildren 12 and 10 are huge Harry Potter fans (read the books multiple times and seen the movies multiple times) absolutely loved this game. It was played several times over the holidays. Recommend for any Clue/Harry Potter fans.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturers defect?
customer_reviews.text: The die is supposed to have symbols on it but ours is blank. Early Christmas shopping and missed my return window! Can’t play the game with this. Disappointed kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game.
customer_reviews.text: A bit different from original game. Kind of confusing. But overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces.
customer_reviews.text: There are pieces missing from this box. The main dice, the wheels and other major pieces. :( was so bummed because I got this for my sisters birthday. Took all the pieces apart and tried to assemble the board and weren’t able to. Super upset about this.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Raj

customer_reviews.title: More Fun than the regular Clue!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as a gift to my daughter, but the whole family quickly fell in love with the game. It's now our first pick when we have family game night. It's more fun that the regular clue! Just like in the movies, there are secret passages and hallways that open and close leaving your opponents stuck! We play with a 10 and 12 year old and all love the game!
customer_reviews.author: mark_in_co

customer_reviews.title: We love the new twists this game has
customer_reviews.text: At Thanksgiving after eating, our family settled into this game. We had not played before so were a little slow in getting the board ready, etc., but it gave us time to read and discuss the Rules. As the game went on, even those not playing were standing around watching the game. We love the new twists this game has. I am sure it will be played many times. A good game for 9 years up!
customer_reviews.author: susan callahan

customer_reviews.title: Bad Die
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I had with this game is that the "Hogwarts die" it's supposed to come with, came completely blank. There weren't any stickers or anything that we could put on the die. Otherwise this is an awesome game, they added some new twists to classic Clue that I really enjoy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Schutte

customer_reviews.title: Fun game! Purchased as a gift and we've played ...
customer_reviews.text: Fun game! Purchased as a gift and we've played it quite a few times. It's kind of crummy because Clues isn't necessarily meant for 2 players. We modified the rules though and it works well enough. The rotating wheels to emulate the stair cases are a wicked cool feature.
customer_reviews.author: ricetruck91

customer_reviews.title: Great for Potter fans
customer_reviews.text: 13yo nephew who loves Harry Potter was thrilled. Fun game to play for him and adults who also like HP. Non fans though will have a hard time getting into this. Try explaining to Grandma what a horcrux is!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: favorite game for small gatherings
customer_reviews.text: I love everything Harry Potter and then they came up with Harry Potter Clue! What's not to like? lots of special features make this a superb twist on the old classic Clue game. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Isaacs

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun with added game play from the original
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! It is super fun and everything is Harry Potter related. This version also has more game play to it than just the original clue game so that makes it even better. It was a great addition to our HP game nights.
customer_reviews.author: UKPA

customer_reviews.title: So extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This came with no cards and we didn't open it in time for the return window which expired yesterday. So extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Licoll

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for Harry Potter afficiandos
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my grown-up girls, who love everything Harry Potter. This was no exception. My daughter texted me a picture of her playing it with her new husband and friends who had stopped by for a visit.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Great GAME!
customer_reviews.text: We are huge CLUE fans and love this version of the classic board game. Beautifully illustrated and a nice variation on play.
customer_reviews.author: Olivier Dunrea

customer_reviews.title: I love Harry Potter but my husband does not
customer_reviews.text: I love Harry Potter but my husband does not. This is the perfect way for me to get my fix without him falling asleep on the couch next to me. I also love that it has the added features that makes the Clue game I grew up with a little more dynamic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun
customer_reviews.text: Great new twist on a classic game I loved as a kid. Fun to play with the whole family. The new rules make it more interesting than the original in my opinion. Quality of pieces, board and cards is good and should last as long as my 40 year old original Clue game.
customer_reviews.author: CliffS

customer_reviews.title: We love the game
customer_reviews.text: We love the game. It take a little longer explanation as there are a few more additions to the regular clue game. One the plastic pieces on the room spinners broke right after we got the game and it does make it more difficult to work properly but we make it work with putting something else in the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Stonecipher

customer_reviews.title: This game was so much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This game was so much better than I expected. We are both Clue and Potter fans, and this exceeded all expectations! *Even is you don’t know/love Harry Potter this Clue game rocks. It’s much more suspenseful than regular Clue because the board moves and passages and doors change. There’s also cards that you use that make the game better, too
customer_reviews.author: Phil&Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, paper game pieces. Total trash!
customer_reviews.text: We love Clue and Harry Potter, but the best thing about this game is the box. The game pieces are flimsy, pressed-paper pieces that you press out of sheets of paper stock. It looks like something that would be a free game in a children’s magazine. The price is a complete rip-off! Stick with the original version and buy something else for the Harry Potter fan in your life!
customer_reviews.author: Hiking Mama

customer_reviews.title: Annoying glitches
customer_reviews.text: Game itself is fun. Our game does not stay assembled. Annoying. Our game came without stickers for a die as part of the game. Annoying. Got it out to play a 2nd time and board already a little warped. Went to return on Amazon and missed return date by 10 hours. SMH Hope someone reaches out to us or we have a game that is annoying to play.
customer_reviews.author: micah732

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Potter Fans
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 16 year old daughter . She loved it. A great twist on an old favorite. It follows the basic rules of clue with the addition of spells , house points and moving stairwells without over complicating the game . A must have for any potter fan!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter purchased this game with a birthday gift card. She is a Harry Potter fan and likes the original version of Clue. We played last night for the first time. It takes some time to get the game set up for the first time, but the instructions were relatively clear. We had a great time and like many of the additions to this game over the original version of Clue. Great for Harry Potter fans!
customer_reviews.author: Denise R

customer_reviews.title: Very intricate game.
customer_reviews.text: Though we liked playing the game, it is super involved. Not sure a bunch of 9, 10 and 11 year olds would play it by theirselves. We played with our 10 year old granddaughter and it took awhile for even the grownups to figure out the intricacies of the game.
customer_reviews.author: K. Houdek

customer_reviews.title: We love this twist on Clue
customer_reviews.text: We love this twist on Clue. There are a lot of rooms to get through, but my kids (8 & 10) really enjoy playing as the characters. The best part are the different curses and hexes that may or may not effect you when you roll or land on the Dark Mark. Super fun for Harry Potter Lovers.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun variation of original Clue, but my family members have some complaints about the design. Mainly, the text on the board has very poor contrast and is unnecessarily hard to read. Adds some complexities that are hard to figure out at first, but ultimately make the game more interesting than the original version.
customer_reviews.author: GMA51

customer_reviews.title: We got this for our daughter for Christmas. She ...
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our daughter for Christmas. She was SO excited and set it up to play as soon as she could. Only to discover the stickers for the Hogwarts die were missing, making play impossible. VERY very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: catherine chappell

customer_reviews.title: Would give it a 10 star rating if I could
customer_reviews.text: Very fun twist to this game of clue and a lot of fun to play with the family, would much rather play this over the original version any day not only because it’s a Harry Potter version but because it’s actually a lot of fun and much more challenging
customer_reviews.author: Rohbock

customer_reviews.title: Recipient loved it, AND
customer_reviews.text: Sent as a gift. Recipient loved it, AND... really FAST delivery to Puerto Rico!
customer_reviews.author: MysteryMan

customer_reviews.title: Really fun game! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my brother but have played it with him. The rules seem a bit complicated at first but it's actually really easy to play; just like the classic Clue but with a couple Hogwarts twists that bring in a bit of the luck element to the game. We loved it! The only bad thing is that some of the cards came attached and, when separating them, they got slightly damaged. Also the tokens are made of cardboard and would be better if they were more resistant. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Catarina Fonseca

customer_reviews.title: Fun game, but may need to help kids with directions
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my children who had never heard of Clue before (made me feel old). They have had a great time playing the game although the directions are a little confusing at times figuring out how to travel from room to room.
customer_reviews.author: motherof3

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!
customer_reviews.text: I've never really enjoyed the normal game of Clue, but as a huge Harry Potter fan, this game is a blast. The way the doors between rooms open and close each turn adds a really fun element.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Great, Unique Game
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun game to play as a family. Unlike regular Clue, it has secret passages, doors, and some other game mechanics not in the original Clue. It isn't just a rebrand with "Harry Potter" in the name to attract customers. After playing this game as a family, I bought it for a friend who loves Harry Potter, and they practically hugged the package after opening it.
customer_reviews.author: iwalton3

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but extra complexity that takes time to master
customer_reviews.text: This was a lot of fun -- takes some time to get used to how the rooms change - which doors are open and closed and which rooms you can hop to. There are also extra decks of magical cards, and it is taking some time to learn how to use them strategically. But overall, we are enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Good board game for an older child who is also a Harry Potter fan.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift for an 11 year old who has avidly read all the Harry Potter books multiple times. He has played this game multiple times and really enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M Josephson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game! Damaged box.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome version of clue!! I bought it for my 7th grade students to play at school on a “fun” day and they LOVED it! I took off a star in my rating because the box was damaged. The corners were smashed and there was a hole in the middle of the top (large enough for pieces to fall out). I did not buy the open box/amazon warehouse version. It was wrapped in plastic and the hole was through the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Game
customer_reviews.text: The kids really need to like board games. This is a game that needs to have your attention. If you are a scatter body then this game might not be for you...
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Cieplinski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This game is sooo much fun. We've always liked Clue and this version takes it to the next level. The stairway changes and the curses and the particular details from the books were fabulous and really added a lot of fun. We are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: ReneeP78

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a Harry Potter fan
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my granddaughter. I can't remember how many times we have played since Christmas. She loved it! I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mycou

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Game!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love how this game looks! It's kind of different from the original game of Clue. I love how it is so Harry Potter themed and makes you feel like you're an actual student at Hogwarts moving around the castle! Make sure to read all the directions thoroughly to truly understand how the game is played.
customer_reviews.author: Baraa

customer_reviews.title: Harry Does Have a Clue!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for a family member, who loves Harry Potter and loves the game of Clue. This game exceeded expectations and provided a nice twist to the classic game. Received the well-packed package on time and in excellent condition - made a great gift. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: K2C

customer_reviews.title: This is a great twist on the Clue game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great twist on the Clue game. I was nervous about the age range but really think it is more for the actual clue game. "Who killed who with what" makes sense to have a 9+ rating. But this game is "who used dark magic on who" So less dramatic and easy for my 6 year old to play.
customer_reviews.author: nagromd

customer_reviews.title: This is the coolest game for a Harry Potter fan ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest game for a Harry Potter fan. It was well thought out and planned, and even has moving staircases. While it is CLUE based, it is very much its own game. There is a bit of strategy involved, but my 7 year old was still able to understand how to play effectively.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic version of Clue
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic version of Clue. If you are a harry potter fan this is a must for you and your family. The game does have an extra layer of complexity with house points and other cards that you get. It does make for a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewerofStuff

customer_reviews.title: Got what I wanted, when I wanted it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a present, and got it on time. The game box had a couple of blemishes, but I blame on the shipper (the box it came in was beat up). However, no one really notice that; and after opening and playing two rounds, no one ever will.
customer_reviews.author: Joe O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Creative, and Fun Harry Potter Twists to the Classic Game
customer_reviews.text: This game was fantastic! It took the classic Clue game and added some fun twists that make it more interesting and more complicated. It takes a few minutes to figure out the rules but then you've got it. The Harry Potter elements they added were very fun and change how the game plays. This was an excellent game.
customer_reviews.author: Katria L

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: So this game is only fun if you have at least 3 Potterheads in your life, and luckily we do. It's so much fun to play on family game nights!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Eaves

customer_reviews.title: Great rule additions and theme
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! The Harry Potter theme works extremely well, but the additional rules make clue a much more interesting game. The board layout is much closer to the orginal (small squares rather than the newer rectangle squares that rarely leave you out of a room). The rotating disks and dark mark effects (with possible defenses) add a great dimension to the game and the possibility of losing all your house points gives a sense of immediacy to the game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun and it is a great twist on the original clue. We have played it with our family and friends, everyone loves it.
customer_reviews.author: andedawn

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic experience for my 8 and 10 yr Olds
customer_reviews.text: My girls and I are huge harry potter and board game fans. This game took a little time for my kids to figure out, but they had it figured out after the first game. We have played it 4 to 5 time for the past 3 weeks now. I highly recommend this game
customer_reviews.author: thewavebb

customer_reviews.title: Confusing
customer_reviews.text: Very confusing to play. We got annoyed and stopped playing after 15 minutes. (Kids were Harry Potter experts too)
customer_reviews.author: M B

customer_reviews.title: Harry Potter fan or boardgame fan, this is a fun game
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun adaptation of the Clue theme. Harry Potter characters in a Hogwarts theme, using charms and spells for their nefarious schemes. Moving staircases and entrances that shut and open. Santa gave this game to our Harry-Potter-loving daughter-in-law and the family ended up playing for hours. Needless to say, she was thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: ar&mkcj

customer_reviews.title: Great game for HP fans!
customer_reviews.text: The game came in very good packaging, and it was really fun. It made me remember playing clue as a child, but also was great for Harry Potter fans. It is a great game to play for a game night, and it is nice because the outcome is always different.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This adds so much depth to an already fun game.
customer_reviews.author: Links2me

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: Great game with a twist on the old game of Clue. My family and I finally got a chance to play it after ordering it. However the game board is a little hard to see since it’s all one beige color. The rooms should’ve been color coded. Also the checkoff sheet is hard to read because it’s light in color and alternates from light to lighter every other line.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated, makes it NOT fun
customer_reviews.text: Clue was my fave game as a kid, so I told my mom to get my 11-year this for his bday, since he loves HP. But this game is so complicated. It's not that it's too hard for an 11-year old, it is just too complicated to be fun. Too many additions and changes from the original Clue. Just keep it classic...
customer_reviews.author: CRamon

customer_reviews.title: Great game for both Potter and board game fans!
customer_reviews.text: What a terrific game for our family of Potter fans, and a fantastic birthday gift our kiddo!! It is different enough from classic Clue to add a learning curve, and definitely for the suggested ages and up. We have quite enjoyed this addition to family game night!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: USAOPOLY Clue Harry Potter Board Game | Travel Through Hogwarts Castle to Solve the Mystery | Official Harry Potter Licensed Merchandise | Harry Potter Themed Board Game | Gift for Harry Potter Fans
product_meta.description: A fellow student has seemingly vanished from the famous School of Witchcraft and Wizardry - and it is up to you to solve the mysterious disappearance. Playing as Harry, Ron, Hermione, Ginny, Luna or Neville, you must try and discover WHO did it, WHAT spell or item they used and WHERE the student was attacked. Move around Hogwarts making suggestions. But watch out! Wheels on the board will keep changing revealing secret passages, moving staircases or even the Dark Mark! Protection from the Dark Mark comes from the spells, allies and items provided by the Help Cards. When you're sure of your facts go to Dumbledore's office to make your accusation and win the game! 3-5 Players
feature_bullets: Game board features wheels which move the rooms and reveal secret passages!
Solve the mystery of a students disappearance from Hogwarts! Ready your magic wand and prepare to solve the mystery across the many rooms of Hogwarts Castle.
Play as your favorite Harry Potter character - Harry Potter, Ron Weasley, Hermione Granger, Ginny Weasley, Luna Lovegood, and Neville Longbottom
A great board games for families and a perfect gift for Harry Potter fans! Featuring room locations from the Harry Potter books and Harry Potter movies - they have come to life in this Clue game.
